alert.note: Alert for Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 8:29AM CDT until October 29 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Walnut Creek Near Mansfield affecting Tarrant County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut Creek near Mansfield. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding will occur along the creek through Mansfield, downstream of Joe Pool Lake. By 19 feet, Retta Road is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain above flood stage into this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage this afternoon to 10.3 feet late tonight. It will then rise to 10.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
